content: This is for discussion of this unprecedented event (It is, yes??), including how to reach out & find everyone who should know about the event, and/or logistics, and/or anything else.

@Rien Wertheim 's announcment said "Know someone who might want to participate?"

To attract people will we use a so-called "snowball methodology," aka plain old word-of-mouth networking? Or can we be more methodical about this?

We know the T1Diabetes world is already up to its eyeballs. What other patient communities? Let's think about reaching out to Inspire.com and other formal patient communities.
Do you have a list of communities we can reach out @Dave deBronkart ?
is it a stupid id to think about some kind of podcast thing out of the track? or vidcast?
I'm going to push it in my media work now
Not a stupid idea at all. We need someone with max exposure to do this.
I promoted it on my blog -- https://healthcaresecprivacy.blogspot.com/2019/08/the-patient-innovator-track-at-devdays.html

Rare disease community, childhood illness community, disability community, biohacking community, and even the fitness community... it's actually relevant to a very large number of people. How those communities intersect with developer/programming communities, however...

While on holiday I missed a lot of this thread, sorry. A quick first response:

  • My site has an ad hoc list of patient communities
  • The greatest leverage will come from connecting with the "meta-communities" (communities of communities) at SmartPatients, Inspire, and NORD

I have good contacts at the first two, and NORD is easy to reach.

My head is full of things we want to do before, during and after Atlanta to publicize this. Who among ye can be my organizing partner(s)? Lists are my downfall.
